I know the new Rammus splash art has been contentious, and some of its criticisms have been fair (he doesn't look as absent-minded or aloof anymore, which is kind of the pinnacle of his personality), but in spite of this, I really love his new artwork--I think he looks adorable and his pose is exciting, even if it's not the super serious or calm portrayal of Rammus we're used to seeing.

The problem with the new splash is, I stress, NOT because he does not look apathetic. He could very well be quite [engaged](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/f/6kFXY1kR/d/mkfQRnuJ) in the moment and would still be very representative of him. The main problem is that the setting and composition of the piece does not do justice in conveying his identity **clearly** and **effectively**.
